posts.post_content: Don't compare this to [Divination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divination). Try [Lead the Stampede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lead the Stampede). Sure, this can get also lands, but I find that Lead the Stampede is usually much better, especially late in the game.
posts.html:
Don't compare this to Divination. Try Lead the Stampede. Sure, this can get also lands, but I find that Lead the Stampede is usually much better, especially late in the game.

Posted By: marmaris74 (5/1/2012 4:49:48 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
[Divination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divination), [Lead the Stampede](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lead the Stampede), and [Harmonize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Harmonize) are all fine comparisons, but check out [Gift of the Gargantuan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gift of the Gargantuan) and [Enshrined Memories](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enshrined Memories).  
  
This is almost always a bad Gift of the Gargantuan, unless the top two cards are both lands or both creatures (which, in most decks playing this, you could voluntarily pull with Gift of the Gargantuan, anyway).  
  
It also functions as a 2-point Enshrined Memories, except of course that it can get lands.  
  
It seems strange that they'd print [Mulch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mulch) in Innistrad (puts leftovers in graveyard), [Tracker's Instincts](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tracker's Instincts) in Dark Ascension (puts leftovers in graveyard), and then this in Avacyn Restored (puts leftovers under library).
posts.html:
Divination, Lead the Stampede, and Harmonize are all fine comparisons, but check out Gift of the Gargantuan and Enshrined Memories.

This is almost always a bad Gift of the Gargantuan, unless the top two cards are both lands or both creatures (which, in most decks playing this, you could voluntarily pull with Gift of the Gargantuan, anyway).

It also functions as a 2-point Enshrined Memories, except of course that it can get lands.

It seems strange that they'd print Mulch in Innistrad (puts leftovers in graveyard), Tracker's Instincts in Dark Ascension (puts leftovers in graveyard), and then this in Avacyn Restored (puts leftovers under library).

posts.post_content:
This is green card "draw" at common - more casual pauper decks might consider it. Rather unusual and gets a little better for that, but it doesn't compense the fact that's still a bad [Gift of the Gargantuan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gift of the Gargantuan).  
Also, the name and art are excellent. Makes me want to design a mini-quest for D&D based on it. Would make more sense if it did something based on graveyards, though.

Posted By: A0602 (4/28/2012 2:38:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This isn't good at all in limited: Usually, you'd like to keep all the cards that you can get without burying them into the library.   
  
Creatures and lands are a big aspect of good limited play, but what if you needed a [Snare the Skies](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Snare the Skies)? You wouldn't play this to find it, making it a dead-drop at the moment.  
  
This was consistently a last-pick card that even if you were going mono-green, you wouldn't play it. If you had maybe 20 creatures, then you should consider it.
posts.html:
This isn't good at all in limited: Usually, you'd like to keep all the cards that you can get without burying them into the library.

Creatures and lands are a big aspect of good limited play, but what if you needed a Snare the Skies? You wouldn't play this to find it, making it a dead-drop at the moment.

This was consistently a last-pick card that even if you were going mono-green, you wouldn't play it. If you had maybe 20 creatures, then you should consider it.

posts.post_content: Interestingly enough, the comparisons to [Divination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divination) are fairly correct. Considering this is for a green deck, you will chiefly be running creatures so it isn't a total stretch to think you'd be drawing 2 lands, 2 creatures, or 1 land and 1 creature most of the time. I can't say whether this will find a place outside of Standard, but I do like it.

Posted By: Eternal_Blue (4/29/2012 11:41:07 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Atleast this is a different approach to green card advantage.  
  
The cost, and flavor-rich dynamic is great, but digging for two might have made more sense in Dark Ascension where flashback was abundant. Flashback ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) would have made up for the inconsistent draw, but drawing three cards for ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Green](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=G&type=symbol) would probably be stepping too far into blue's territory (See [Jace's Ingenuity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace's Ingenuity)).  
  
I think at common rarity, this is still a fair choice for green card advantage. 4/5
posts.html:
Atleast this is a different approach to green card advantage.

Flashback would have made up for the inconsistent draw, but drawing three cards for would probably be stepping too far into blue's territory (See Jace's Ingenuity).

I think at common rarity, this is still a fair choice for green card advantage. 4/5
